Additional information...

When I run these tests under the JUnit 3.2 LoadingTestRunner, I get a 
NoClassDefFoundException for a class that I know is in my classpath 
(though it is in a JAR file...if that makes a difference).

When I run these tests under the JUnit 3.4 TestRunner, I get a 
NoClassDefFoundException for java.lang.Throwable.

Hope this helps anyone that might have an idea what this problem is.

Thanks.
subject: Re: Problems going from JUnit 3.2 to 3.4
